review_reason: The chloroplast organization defects are a downstream consequence of impaired group II intron splicing. While the phenotype is real, it represents an indirect effect rather than a core function of APO1.

original_reference_title: APO1 promotes the splicing of chloroplast group II introns and harbors a plant-specific zinc-dependent RNA binding domain.
